Draw the first line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.45, 0.0). b. Draw the second line from point (0.45, 0.0) to point (0.45, 0.15). c. Draw the third line from point (0.45, 0.15) to point (0.0, 0.15). d. Draw the fourth line from point (0.0, 0.15) to point (0.0, 0.0). 3. **Create five loops in the sketch:** Each loop will be constructed using different curve elements as described below. a. **Loop 1:** A closed loop using lines 1, 2, 3, and 4. b. **Loop 2:** A closed loop consisting of one circular arc. The center is at (0.0712, 0.075) with a radius of 0.0038. c. **Loop 3:** A closed loop consisting of one circular arc. The center is at (0.15, 0.075) with a radius of 0.0075. d. **Loop 4:** A closed loop consisting of one circular arc. The center is at (0.24, 0.075) with a radius of 0.015. e. **Loop 5:** A closed loop consisting of one circular arc. The center is at (0.3525, 0.075) with a radius of 0.03. 4. **Scale the 2D sketch:** Apply a scaling factor of 0.45 to the entire sketch. 5. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch:** Perform a 3D rotation using the euler angles and translate it by the specified translation vector. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch:** Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by 0.75 units, creating the final 3D model.</description>

The length of the side is twice the height of the prism. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other.</description>
